titleStmt.title: Francisca Ey to James F. Robinson
CWG8551

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: Sir! The subscriber your petitioner would respectfully state, that her husband John Ey, got in a difficulty with somebody who lived in the same house with him, when he was arrested and fined forty dollars & costs, for which he had to give Security, now your petitioner would state that her husband has been these last 12 months in the U. S. Service, also his Brother is in Service and the Officers of the City Court are very clamorous to collect the fine, your petitioner is very poor and not able to pay the fine at this time, and (should she be compelled) that the security has to pay the above sum, her husband is bound to pay the same back, and that will take 3 months wages. There is now some $2500 cost to pay, she your petitioner is willing to pay that, if your Exellency will have the kindness to remit the fine, and your petitioner flatters herself that you will grand her request.
I am well acquainted with the above parties and vouch for the truth thereof

Louisville City Ct
Pttn granted fine remitted
30th Octo 1862
J F Robinson
$40. } Affray
Issd Octr 30 1862
